;Recently, a video of poor college students crying about being squeezed out of their scholarship qualifications has been widely circulated on social networks. attracted great attention. Tianjin Sino-German University of Applied Sciences, which was involved in the incident, said on November 2 that it had set up a special work team to conduct investigation and verification as soon as possible. The subsequent investigation results will be handled in accordance with regulations and announced in a timely manner.

;

;In the video posted online, a boy said that his father died and his mother married when he was young. His grandfather also died when he was 18 years old. Now he only has his grandma as a relative. Their family is registered locally. poor households. After entering college, he received national scholarships in previous years, but this year, the class held a scholarship qualification selection, and he was not selected. The students who were selected were wearing real AJ sneakers (a sneaker brand owned by Nike, the price Not cheap), using Apple 14 Pro Max mobile phone and iPad Pro tablet, often having dinner parties and traveling. He reported the situation to the counselor, but was forced to move out of the dormitory.

;

;If this is true, it is really outrageous, and this video has attracted a lot of attention.

;

;In reality, fraud in scholarship applications is nothing new in some colleges and universities. National scholarships for colleges and universities are financial aid provided by the state finance to college students with financial difficulties. They are mainly used to meet the living expenses of students. The average aid standard is 3,000 yuan per person per year (not equal, can be divided into 2-3 levels), about 20% students may receive financial aid. Bursaries are a benefit provided by the state to some poor college students. Since it is welfare, how to distribute it and how to let people who really need it get this money is a very important issue.

;

;According to this student, the scholarship qualifications for his class were selected by the whole class because he was not satisfied with the results of the first selection and went to the teacher to report it. As a result, he came last in the second selection. , became the person least qualified to receive scholarships in the class. The whole class selection seems very "reasonable", but when used here, it is undoubtedly very absurd.

;

;Who is in financial difficulty and who is not is not a matter decided by one person and one vote. If the selection is held, it will become a "connection" competition, and it is inevitable that some students will form gangs and even bribe the vote. As for truly poor students, they may not be able to mingle with better-off classmates due to financial constraints, and as a result, they may not be eligible for financial aid. On social networks, it is not uncommon for a group of people to "unite together" to promote one person to receive a scholarship and treat them to dinner, and then another person will take turns to receive it next time. Such posts are not uncommon. As a result, some colleges and universities have issued notices that award-winning students are not allowed to use their scholarships to treat guests, otherwise their qualifications for future assessments will be cancelled.

;

;Some schools and classes even ask students applying for financial aid to tell their situations in front of the whole class and "campaign" for financial aid. This is letting people show their scars for others to see, which may cause a huge blow to the students' self-esteem. Although some students are poor, they do not want others to know, especially in public. After all, poverty is not something worth showing off, and not everyone is compassionate. It is common for students to laugh at poor students in school.

;

;It is also not a good idea to let counselors, class teachers, etc. have the decision-making power about scholarship eligibility. First of all, it is difficult to ensure that these people are completely public-minded in the quota allocation process. Maybe most counselors are fair, but it is inevitable that there will be a few who are partial. Sometimes, financial aid eligibility may even become a tool to blackmail students into "obedience." Secondly, counselors and others may not be able to fully understand the students' financial situation, and lack sufficient and correct information to make correct judgments.

;

;There should be some objective criteria for determining scholarship qualifications, rather than just subjective determination, whether it is the subjectivity of an individual person (identification by the counselor or class teacher) or the subjectivity of the entire class (selection by the whole class) .

;

;What is the objective standard? Theoretically, it can be whether the student's family income is below a certain standard. However, schools cannot directly obtain the income and assets of students' families, so many schools ask poor students to provide poverty certificates from village committees or neighborhood committees. But these proofs are not entirely credible. For one, these proofs of poverty are not necessarily true. Especially for many rural areas, when village students are admitted to college, even if their families are not particularly poor, it is not difficult to go to the village committee to issue a poverty certificate. After all, they are all fellow villagers, and a certificate can alleviate the family's financial burden. Many village cadres will cover the burden unless the family's income is significantly higher than the village average. Secondly, the poverty standards in different regions are also different. Poverty in economically developed regions and poverty in western regions are completely different concepts. In recent years, there have been frequent cases of government officials visiting "poor" people and being criticized. Although some of them are falsely poor, there are also some misunderstandings caused by differences in regional economic levels. Therefore, the family poverty certificate issued by the place of origin can only be a reference and should not be used as a deciding factor.

;

;How should the scholarship qualifications be determined? This is of course a very complex issue and difficult to achieve completely ideally. But there are still some standards that can be referenced. For example, applying for a student loan can be a necessary condition. In the national student aid policy system, student loans are mainly used to solve the tuition and accommodation fees problems of students with financial difficulties. Nowadays, the tuition and accommodation fees of most schools are much higher than the scholarship standards. If you can pay for tuition and accommodation by yourself, it means you are not too poor. Otherwise, you can apply for a student loan to pay tuition and keep your own money for living expenses.

;

;You can also observe students’ consumption on campus. The approach of Nanjing University of Science and Technology is a good reference. In 2016, Nanjing University of Science and Technology analyzed student consumption data in the cafeteria and listed those students who ate more than 60 meals in the cafeteria per month with a total consumption of no more than 420 yuan as aid recipients, and paid money directly to their meal cards. This is a very smart approach. As we all know, food in school cafeterias is much cheaper than outside. If a student eats almost every meal in the school cafeteria and the average consumption per meal is not high, there is a high probability that he is a poor student. Rich students either eat less in the on-campus cafeteria and often eat out and order takeout, or they spend more in the cafeteria and eat well. Eating is a basic necessity for people, whether rich or poor, everyone needs to eat, so using food consumption level as a measurement standard can cover all students. And the level of food consumption is difficult to fake. It is difficult for a person who is accustomed to a high standard of diet to continue to lower his dietary standards for a few months if the economic conditions do not change. Of course, this approach may also be used opportunistically, eating a little in the cafeteria for each meal, and then going out to eat and drink, but I am afraid that there are not many rich people who can persist in this way.

;

;In short, as a welfare provided by the national finance to poor students, the national scholarship should be used wisely to truly reduce the burden of life for poor students, and should not become Tang Monk meat that everyone wants to eat. Tianjin Sino-German University of Applied Sciences officially stated that it has launched an investigation and hopes that the investigation and handling results will be fair and just. More importantly, the problem of unfair distribution of scholarships occurs in many colleges and universities, and should arouse the vigilance of all colleges and universities.

;

;During the climb, there were crisscrossing and completely irregular ice cracks underfoot. Zhang Hong You need to use trekking poles to test the location and terrain first, then use your feet to measure the approximate width of the crevasse, and finally dare to step out. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Standing on the top of the world's highest peak, blind man Zhang Hong's first thought was " Get down quickly."

;

;“Most of the mountaineering accidents occur on the way down the mountain.” Zhang Hong said that when climbing, a person’s center of gravity is first. Even if he falls, the mountain will block him. When going down the mountain, “it all depends on the subconscious mind.” . He felt at ease until he returned to Everest Base Camp and took off his crampons - which meant that danger was truly far away. Sherpa (note: local people living on both sides of the Himalayas, usually serving as guides) gave him a cup of milk tea and a few biscuits to satisfy his hunger. The climb to the summit and back nearly exhausted his strength, and he nearly fell into coma.

;

;Two years later, the cognitive system composed of sound, hearing and touch makes his memories of the world’s highest peak still vivid. He clearly felt the difference in wind at different altitudes: the wind from the glaciers at low altitudes was mixed with freezing cold air, the storms at high altitudes made loud noises, and the strong winds picked up snow particles, ice slag and small rocks, giving people a sticky feel. , like a high wall that is insurmountable.

;

;Hiking across the glacier, the ice on the soles of your feet has a hard texture, and there is a "click" sound like biting potato chips when you step on it. Even with crampons, the risk of slipping is unavoidable. The snow is thick, and the sound of footsteps is muffled in it, giving people a more solid feeling.

;

;On May 24, 2021, at the 8848.86-meter summit of Mount Everest, Zhang Hong followed the example of his predecessors and left several photos and a 15-second short video. The former became his WeChat avatar, and the latter was the certificate of his record as "the first blind man in Asia to climb Mount Everest".

;

;When the news of the successful summit reached Fan Lixin’s base camp, the documentary director had mixed emotions.

;

;He was happy that Zhang Hong’s years of hard work had paid off. In 2019, he heard about Zhang Hong's ambition from a mountaineering friend: a blind masseur eager to climb Mount Everest. Everyone around him thought it was unreliable, but Fan Lixin became curious about this character. Like a gambler, he wanted to film this story that was very likely to fail. In May 2020, the documentary was launched, and the fate of the two "paranoid" people intersected since then.

;

;What is worrying is that due to an oxygen problem, the two accompanying photographers were not able to go up together. The video footage of Zhang Hong’s summit was blank. Fan Lixin cried out that she collapsed, “It’s hard for a clever woman to make a meal without rice.” On October 27, 2023, the documentary "The Invisible Peak" was released nationwide. Fan Lixin filled the gap in the material with a "black" segment.

;

;"We shot more than 360 hours of material, and it took a year to edit. When editing, I was thinking, if there is no material for this section, why not use a black field and an immersive (Sound experience), immersing the audience into the world of a blind person." Fan Lixin told Southern Weekend reporters, "Use this black field to take the audience to the top of the world, following Zhang Hong's footsteps."

; < p>;;

;

;Zhang Hong and his wife Xia Qiong. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Zhang Hong has an almost paranoid desire to climb Mount Everest. At that time, he was working as the deputy director of the Traditional Chinese Medicine Department of a hospital in Tibet. He was in his forties, had a stable job, worked with his wife, and had a son. Everyone was puzzled by his "crazy" desire to climb Mount Everest: "This thing is completely unreliable. I have such a good job in my hand, and I have stabilized, and I still want to do this. This is full." I can hold on."

;

;Zhang Hong admitted that obsession comes from a certain desire to prove something. "I used to label myself as an unfortunate person in society. But the process of climbing Mount Everest taught me one thing: In fact, I am the same as everyone else, and society and nature have no regard for me. I don’t look at it differently.”

;

;;“Mount Everest will not give me more sympathy just because I am blind”;

;

;Official filming of the summit Fan Lixin followed Zhang Hong for more than a year. At that time, Zhang Hong's biggest anxiety during his trip to Mount Everest was money. When the documentary was launched, Zhang Hong received support of US$5,000 from a foundation, but there was still a big gap between the "small one million" RMB. In front of the camera, Zhang Hong took advantage of the wine and asked his brother in embarrassment.

;

;"I didn't know much about it at the time. To be honest, I was quite anxious. If he couldn't raise the money, he wouldn't be able to go even if he wanted to," Fan Lixin told a reporter from Southern Weekend. "It's possible that he would become a The story of 'Don Quixote.'" Later, through crowdfunding, brand intervention, and hospital support, Zhang Hong was able to scrape together the money one week before departure.

;

;Zhang Hong took the traditional route to climb Mount Everest. Take a helicopter or small fixed-wing plane from Kathmandu, the capital of Nepal, to the small town of Lukla, and then hike for 7 days to the Everest base camp, which is "equivalent to initial adaptive training." After a short rest at the base camp, the team conducted two training sessions. The destination of the first training session is Lobuche, which is more than 6,100 meters high; the second training session involves climbing to the C3 camp at an altitude of 8,300 meters.

;

;Fan Lixin has never climbed a mountain before, and Luo Buche, who was training for the first time, was the first mountain he had climbed. When he was a child, he had an operation on his leg and one-third of his knee was cut off, making it difficult for him to climb Mount Everest with Zhang Hong. He invited two mountain photographers, including the producer who also served as a sound engineer, and the team was streamlined to only four people.

;

;Climbing from the base camp to the C1 camp, the altitude does not increase much, but you have to pass through the Khumbu Glacier, which is known as the "terrible glacier". There are trenches in the glacier. In the wide ice ravine, two ladders were stacked together to form a bridge, and people and cameras trembled across it. Even Sherpas who have competed with Mount Everest all year round cannot take it lightly. During the filming of the documentary, a Sherpa fell into an ice ravine and hung on by a thread. After the people in the same team worked hard to rescue him, his body was curled up and his ears were purple from the cold.

;

;Climbers with normal vision can take one step and look at ten steps, but Zhang Hong can only stare at the current step. Every step is difficult. With every step he took, he silently recited in his heart: "This snowfield accepted me again, and the footprints under my feet carried me again."

;

;;

;

;When shooting on Mount Everest, the biggest difficulty was the electricity , because the diesel generator needs to come up little by little and can only be charged by solar energy. However, the sun is often not seen for three to five days when climbing, and the documentary team often feels anxious. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;“Everest will not give me more sympathy just because I am blind. There is an ice cave under the glacier, and there is a cliff next to it. The ladder is also shaky, and the difficulty will not be reduced just because I can't see it." Zhang Hong was hit by a similar feeling when he climbed the mountain for the first time, "I can feel that I and Everyone is the same, doing one thing in an equal and fair environment, there is no barrier between me and everyone, instead of before I thought that I was an unfortunate and alternative existence."

;

;However, due to the inability to see, ice climbing poses many obstacles to Zhang Hong. Fan Lixin said that the weather in the Himalayas was bad that year and the road conditions were complicated. When climbing an ice wall, sighted climbers can step on the ice pits that have been stepped on by the person in front of them. But Zhang Hong couldn't see it. The steel crampons under his feet were difficult to accurately kick into the old pit, and it took more effort than ordinary people to kick out the new pit. When hanging on the ice wall, the climber relies on three points of support, pulling the rope with one hand and smashing the ice with an ice ax with the other hand to pull his body upwards.

;

;"We can see it, so we probably know where to hit it, and it will get more force. But he can't see it, so he just chisels randomly. If he chisels once, the ice will fly away and the chisel will be in vain, so he has to chisel again. Climbing an ice wall of more than ten meters is very tiring." Fan Lixin observed.

;

;During the first training session, Zhang Hong suddenly lost his temper and said he no longer wanted to climb, and asked for a helicopter to be sent to pick him up. Some people in the team felt that his pace could not keep up with the progress and slowed down the progress. Zhang Hong looked displeased. "He needs to get in touch with the team. He will feel that the risk is too high. He is not afraid that something will happen to him. What he is most afraid of is that he has not really climbed yet, and he is injured just in training, or his physical strength Exhausted." Fan Lixin told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;“Above five or six thousand meters above sea level, people’s emotions and thinking are completely different from those in the plains.” Zhang Hong analyzed his mentality at the time, “If you haven’t climbed (officially) yet, it’s better to practice. It’s not worth it if you get injured during the training.”

;

;During the second training session, Zhang Hong suffered from an attack of cholecystitis, which caused his facial features to twist tightly together in pain. Back at base camp, the camp doctor examined him. Zhang Hong learned from others that the doctor recommended sending him back to Kathmandu for treatment, "even requiring surgery."

;

;“Once I went to treatment, the climb almost came to a standstill.” Zhang Hong wrapped himself in a sleeping bag and broke down crying. "Time waits for no one, the weather is bad, and the window period is limited, only a few days. You can't give up climbing just because of this."

;

;He blamed himself for not having a plan for this, but he was also optimistic about it. There is nothing that can be done about the pain, except rubbing the abdomen and massaging the liver and gallbladder meridian. One of the reasons why he climbed Mount Everest was to break the outside world's stereotype of blind people. Blind people can not only do massage. But as fate would have it, after two or three days of massage, the symptoms were really relieved.

;

;"Everything is God's will." He said.

;

;;

;

;On May 24, 2021, Zhang Hong, who has been blind for 25 years, successfully climbed the world's highest peak, Mount Everest, from the Nepalese side, becoming the first blind person in Asia to climb Mount Everest. ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;;To the summit;

;

;The moment of reaching the summit Come on May 23, 2021 at 7pm. Zhang Hong, the Chinese guide, photographer and Sherpa set off from the C4 camp to the top of Mount Everest. When we were only 100 meters away from the peak, something unexpected happened.

;

;The bad weather froze everyone's oxygen regulator valves, causing oxygen leaks. Taken together, the current amount of oxygen cannot support everyone reaching the summit. Qiangzi is Zhang Hong's Chinese guide. He has 15 years of experience as a mountain guide, but has never climbed Mount Everest. For mountaineers, the 100 meters that can be climbed in 2 hours is a "huge temptation."

;

;Hadron finally decided to give up his oxygen, and the two photographers made the same decision. The three of them descended, and Sherpa accompanied Zhang Hong to the summit alone.

;

;Fan Lixin later asked about the reason for giving up. Qiangzi said that in the three or four years he had known Zhang Hong, he had witnessed his difficulties and grievances along the way. "I really don't want him to leave again. Maybe he will never have a second chance to leave again in this life. Training, raising money, withstanding the public opinion of the surrounding society, and the doubts of relatives and friends - you see No, why are you taking such a big risk? No one would think that a blind person also has the right to realize his own ideals, pursue his own value in life, and at the same time give his family a voice."

;

;Three Summers Erba and Zhang Hong were connected on a rope, and Zhang Hong pushed the ascender forward. A Sherpa led the way about 1.5 meters in front. The two of them did not understand the language and only relied on simple English words "go", "up" and "down" to communicate. There were two Sherpas carrying oxygen behind him, and one of them occasionally patted his legs to "express comfort and encouragement."

;

;Before climbing to the top, the most difficult section is the "Hillary Steps", which is a blade-shaped ridge with almost vertical rock walls that "cannot even catch snow". Zhang Hong estimated that the narrow spot is only about 30 centimeters, which can only accommodate half a foot.

;

;The hands became his eyes at this time. He supported it with one hand, and used the other hand to explore the way forward along the tip of his toes. After finding the foothold for the next step, he used the other hand to find the support point. Every time he took a step, he "had to stop and rest for a long time." Zhang Hong said that climbing the Hillary Step was like walking through the artificial rockery he had seen when his eyesight was still intact. The stone gaps were completely irregular and "I didn't know what to do next."

;

;The "Hillary Steps" are only 12 meters from the peak, but it took Zhang Hong more than two hours. When climbing, he lost the concept of time for a while. He would swing the rope left and right at intervals and ask the Sherpa who was leading the way: "How long? How long?" Sherpa's answer was half an hour every time.

;

;"The results haven't arrived after several and a half hours. Maybe I asked how long it would be after 5 minutes, and then asked again after 10 minutes." Zhang Hong was a little anxious and said several times. No,” “I’m going to die,” “I’m going down.” At first Sherpa ignored his complaints, but the last time Sherpa was also angry. He emotionally agreed to Zhang Hong's request to give up, and turned around to help him remove the ascender and replace it with the descender.

;

;;

;

;Fan Lixin recalled that there were two or three major cyclones in the Indian Ocean that year, which caused heavy snow and strong winds on Mount Everest. On the day Zhang Hong reached the summit, the wind speed reached 60 kilometers per hour, and people were almost killed. If it blows down, if the clothes are scratched and the down flies off, the consequence will be "instant hypothermia and death." ;(Photo courtesy of interviewee);

;

;Unwillingness gripped Zhang Hong, and he said to Sherpa: "Go ! Go! Go! ""Keep walking."

;

;While crawling, Zhang Hong suddenly felt his crampons stepping on a soft snow. The further he walked, the thicker the snow became. Until the snow is deep enough to cover the entire sole of the foot. He suddenly bumped into the backpack of the person in front of him. "You summit." He heard the leading Sherpa turn his head and say to him.

;

;“I didn’t think I had really reached the top.” Zhang Hong recalled, “I didn’t know where I was going, but I just walked like this. Maybe I was too tired and couldn’t take a step from He can react with his concentration."

;

;His senses captured the changes in the surrounding environment before his consciousness.

;

;While going up the mountain, Zhang Hong invisibly felt that the mountain he was climbing was like a huge obstacle blocking his face. But in that moment, the barrier disappeared. He could hear the surroundings becoming empty, the kind of emptiness that was unobstructed. He turned his head to the left, then to the right, and listened carefully to the sounds around him. The sound of wind swirling violently on his head made his hair stand on end.

;

;They didn’t stay on the top of Mount Everest for a long time. Zhang Hong heard Sherpa say, “Photo, photo,” and quickly took a few photos. It wasn’t until they got down the mountain that they found out, and even took photos for certification. video. He later told Fan Lixin that he only heard various incomprehensible languages ​​blaring on the intercom.

;

;"When he thought about that moment, it was even a little ridiculous. He had prepared for so many years, prepared many postures and rhetoric to say on Mount Everest, but nothing, just 2 seconds, he He woke up and said, hurry down, this place is too scary, like hell, the howling of the wind." Fan Lixin recalled, "When he was blind before, he really felt that the world was collapsing, just like in hell. He said that I I have been climbing for 20 years, climbing from hell to flat ground, and then from flat ground to the top of Mount Everest. (When I reached the summit) I felt as if I was in hell again, so I hurried down the mountain."

;

;End of the climb Later, they were trapped in Nepal by a new wave of COVID-19. At that time, it was the most noisy time outside. Fan Lixin counted that more than 70 international mainstream media, including the BBC and AFP, were reporting on him. Zhang Hong said that he was not immersed in the feeling of being under the spotlight at the time.

;

;"After he climbed Mount Everest, he discovered that climbing Mount Everest was not the highlight moment he needed at all, but made him understand that the current step is the most important. Because this step has not been stepped on Well, you may just fall and you will be dead. There is no so-called highlight moment at all. The real highlight moment may just begin when you are in the most dangerous moment. The guide in the movie also said: Climbing to the top is not the end. Returning to the top is not the end. Home is the end." When he was in Nepal, Fan Lixin chatted with him, "He said, now you tell me that where I am standing is the top of Mount Everest, and I believe it because I can't see it."

;

;;He wanted others to think that blind people can not only be masseurs;

;

;When he first started filming Zhang Hong, Fan Lixin felt that he was a somewhat impatient person, debugging equipment or Zhang Hong would look a little anxious when it was time to replace the battery.

;

;The impatience comes from his sudden blindness. At the age of 21, he suffered a glaucoma attack and permanently lost his vision. It took three or four years for Zhang Hong to try to accept being unable to see, and his personality changed as a result. He became "emotionally broken" and "bad-tempered". He failed to get what he wanted, or accidentally knocked over a cup. They will show their impatient side.

;

;My wife Xia Qiong captured these moments softly. She once tried to put herself in her husband's shoes, shut herself in the room, turned off all the lights, and closed the windows tightly. "It felt like the four walls were squeezing in on you." She realized her husband's nervousness about danger in an unknown environment. "It was originally a very docile sheep, a free species, but suddenly it was trapped in an invisible black cage."

;

;The environment in which Zhang Hong grew up as a child was closely linked to "blindness". His father and uncle are both blind. He, who has good vision, sometimes acts as a "blind stick". The three of them pull a bamboo pole, and Zhang Hong leads the way. On a rainy day, the road was slippery and Zhang Hong fell, taking his father and uncle with him. In rural society, he had long been aware of the plight of blind people.

;

;“I have known their lives since I was a child, and I cannot accept the thought that I will have to live in such an environment in the future.” Zhang Hong said.

;

;Xia Qiong noticed that family background and childhood memories created a self-defense mechanism in Zhang Hong's heart. Before getting married, Zhang Hong had never taken the initiative to talk to her about his father and uncle. They got acquainted with Zhang Hong when he could still see the world. Later, Zhang Hong lost his sight. She joked that she was "harmed" by Jin Yong's martial arts novels. She bravely felt that "he should not be left alone with no one." Tube". In 1999, the two people, who had been in love for three years, decided to testify.

;

;The family elders unanimously opposed it, and his father cried in front of Xia Qiong. Zhang Hong promised her: "I will definitely make your family look at you with admiration." She thought that maybe it was from that time that he laid the groundwork for her husband's "constant tossing" in the future.

;

;In the two decades before Tibet settled down, Xia Qiong described their life as "precarious." Zhang Hong studied massage in school, but he was not obsessed with it. After he lost his sight, professionalism actually saved him from being unable to eat. Xia Qiong also learned massage. The couple first worked as masseurs in Chengdu and lived a "suffering" life. Later, I went to work in a massage shop in Shanghai, and the two of them were ranked among the "top one or two in the shop."

;

;In 2005, when Xia Qiong went home to give birth, she received health care products from Zhang Hong from Shanghai. She knew that her husband was "troublesome" again. Zhang Hong quit his job behind her back and went to work in sales. "He sometimes told people that he couldn't find a way out in the subway in Shanghai. He was trapped in the subway and at an intersection on the road in Shanghai." Xia Qiong said, "He wanted to let others I feel that blind people can not only be masseurs, but also do other things."

;

;In 2019, after climbing the 7,500-meter Muztagh Peak, Zhang Hong decided to prepare for climbing Mount Everest. In order to save money, he adopted the most cost-effective training method - climbing stairs. While climbing, I put on mountain boots and an oxygen-blocking mask, and carried more than 20 kilograms of weight at the same time. I climbed for three to four hours every day. He lived in the hospital's apartment building and climbed from the first floor to the twelfth floor and then took the elevator down every day. When he met his colleagues in the hospital, he felt the pressure. "Countless people around him questioned him, thinking that this guy was not only blind, but also crazy."

;

;Enduring the strange looks from people around him and the difficulty of not being able to raise funds, Countless times, after he got on the elevator, his fingers hesitated and hesitated between the first floor and the floor where his home was located. "I have been struggling like this for two years."

;

;"Some people may think that it is enough for their wives to have enough food and clothing, and for their children to have enough money to study; some people think that they should set an example for their children, so that the people they love can have a bright face in front of and behind others." Xia Qiong said that her husband Zhang Hong "may be the latter."

;

;After Zhang Hong successfully climbed Mount Everest, some subtle changes occurred. People in the hospital used to refer to Zhang Hong as "Dr. Xia's husband." Now, they call her "Zhang Hong's wife."

;

;When her son was two years old, Xia Qiong and a relative turned off the lights and asked her son in the darkness: Who do you want to protect when it gets dark? The two-year-old son said sweetly: Protect daddy. Xia Qiong and her female relatives were puzzled: We are all women, why should we protect our father? The son said without thinking: Because dad can’t see. Today, the son feels that his father is "very capable" and "relatively strong."

;

;Both Fan Lixin and Xia Qiong observed that after successfully climbing Mount Everest, Zhang Hong became much more relaxed in life. After losing his sight, he had difficulty accepting the feeling of being inferior to others. Like every ordinary person, he has his own shortcomings, but he would rather hear criticism from a straight level than praise from a downward view.

;

;“Before climbing Mount Everest, I had been outside for so many years and never told anyone about my family’s affairs. Only my wife knew about it, and no other person knew about it. But after I came down from Mount Everest, , I can share anything that happens in my family with anyone, including my father and uncle who can’t see me. I couldn’t face it before, but now I can face these things calmly,” Zhang Hong said.

; Sat, 04 Nov 2023 12:25:03 +0800 “制造业当家关键在于人”http://www.infzm.com/contents/259951

;;

;

;In 2008, Hu Xiaoyan was elected as the first batch of migrant workers to the National People's Congress. (Interviewee/picture)

;

;"It took me three days and three nights to get to Foshan, changing trains and buses all the way. So, I My first impression of Guangdong was probably the feeling of motion sickness." It was the late autumn of 1998. Hu Xiaoyan was 24 years old. In order to pay off the foreign debt of more than 20,000 yuan owed by her family, she decided to leave her hometown of Guang'an, Sichuan and embark on the furthest journey in her life. A trip - to work in Guangdong.

;

;35 years later, Hu Xiaoyan is already the full-time vice chairman of Foshan Sanshui District Federation of Industry and Commerce. On October 25, 2023, at the third "Storytelling Meeting on the 45th Anniversary of Reform and Opening Up", she recalled the years when she first arrived in Guangdong to work hard.

;

;In ten years, Hu Xiaoyan rose from a female assembly line worker in an electronics factory to the management of a ceramic production workshop, and was selected as one of the "Top Ten Migrant Workers in Foshan". In 2008, for the first time, three representatives of the migrant workers group participated in the National Two Sessions, including Hu Xiaoyan from Guangdong, a major labor import province.

;

;Since the reform and opening up, the "tide of migrant workers" has promoted China's industrialization and urbanization process. Guangdong is a major labor importer. In 1988 alone, the number of laborers from other provinces who came to work reached about 3 million.

;

;The event was hosted by the Information Office of the Guangdong Provincial Government. In addition to Hu Xiaoyan, Shang Xiaodong, a second-level researcher at the South China Sea Institute of Oceanography, Chinese Academy of Sciences, and a mechanical technician from Guangdong Province were also invited College teacher Yang Denghui tells his story. The three people are from different generations and backgrounds, but what they have in common is that they are all foreign talents from Guangdong. Shang Xiaodong was admitted to Taiyuan Institute of Technology (now Taiyuan University of Technology) after the resumption of the college entrance examination. He entered graduate school at the age of 32. In 2005, he came to Guangdong to research physical ocean research. Yang Denghui, who was born in 1997, is the champion of the CNC milling project of the World Skills Competition. He studied at the Guangdong Mechanical Technician College and was elected as a representative of the 14th National People's Congress.

;

;;

;

;On October 26, 2023, workers at an agricultural technology enterprise in Yunfu City were cultivating flower seedlings. With the help of the local rural revitalization talent station, the company solved the problem of shortage of industrial talents and technology. (Chen Yulong/Photo)

;

;The first batch of migrant workers' representatives

;

;"As the spokesperson of more than 200 million migrant workers, I participated in the 5 During the National Two Sessions, a total of 20 suggestions were put forward, and each suggestion was ultimately implemented for migrant workers." Hu Xiaoyan mentioned that since the reform and opening up, the system for protecting the rights and interests of migrant workers has been changing.

;

;Migrant workers are a group born with the reform and opening up. "Household production quota" liberated rural surplus labor from the land, and a large number of rural people poured into cities in search of opportunities. This trend continues today. According to the National Bureau of Statistics, the number of migrant workers was 78.49 million at the beginning of the century, and the total number in 2022 exceeded 295 million.

;

;Guangdong occupies three of the four major special economic zones identified in 1979, which has created a huge demand for labor. Hu Xiaoyan thus joined the ranks heading south.

;

;The emergence of migrant workers has also highlighted the problem of migrant workers. In 2006, relevant documents from the State Council mentioned that there were problems such as low wages and arrears for migrant workers, and many occupational diseases and work-related injuries.

;

;In January 2008, Yang Chengyong, deputy director of the Election Committee of the Standing Committee of the Guangdong Provincial People's Congress, revealed to the media that Guangdong, as the province with the largest influx of migrant population, planned to elect After six migrant workers were elected as representatives to the Provincial People's Congress, one migrant worker was elected as a deputy to the National People's Congress.

;

;Before that, Guangdong had been at the forefront in protecting the political rights of migrant workers. In 2000, four outsiders were elected during the general election of the Shenzhen Municipal People’s Congress. Representatives of migrant workers.

;

;In the end, Hu Xiaoyan became the first batch of migrant workers to be a deputy to the National People's Congress, but before that, she had never served as a deputy to any people's congress at the township, county, city, or province level. Hu Xiaoyan recalled to Southern Weekend reporters: "I don't find it difficult because I already live among them (migrant workers)."

;

;Hu Xiaoyan mentioned To: "The first batch of migrant workers to represent the National People's Congress became the most eye-catching label on me. From then on, I began to learn how to conduct research, write suggestions, speak, and learn how to perform my duties."

;

;After becoming a deputy to the National People's Congress, she used her vacation time to visit workers and put forward suggestions including criminalizing unpaid wages, connecting with medical insurance, off-site college entrance examinations, and housing benefits.

;

;At almost the same time, national policies also shifted to consider the new needs generated by migrant workers entering cities. Hu Xiaoyan once suggested “allowing the children of migrant workers to take the college entrance examination in the workplace.” At the end of 2013, Guangdong Province officially announced the implementation measures for the college entrance examination for migrant children in other places.

;

;Today, more "Hu Xiaoyans" have become deputies to the National People's Congress. Among the deputies to the 14th National People's Congress, there are 56 migrant workers.

;

;;

;

;;October 2023 On the 26th, students were practicing the operation of industrial robots at the Technician College in Zhaoqing, Guangdong. (Chen Yulong/Photo);

;

;Scientists and Craftsmen

;

;Shang Xiaodong, a 32-year-old graduate student, said that he and Hu Xiaoyan " “Have the same starting point” as shop workers. It's just that it's much older.

;

;The turning point occurred in 1978. Shang Xiaodong heard that his high school classmates were admitted to college, and he began to prepare for the exam. In the second year, he relied on self-study and was admitted to the physics teaching class of the Department of Physics Basics of Taiyuan Institute of Technology. After graduation, he was assigned to serve as a teacher at the Command College of the Chinese People's Armed Police Force.

;

;More than ten years later, he keenly discovered that there were more masters around him, and he felt that "if you don't study, you will fall behind." After completing his postgraduate studies in the Department of Mechanics of Tianjin University, he went to Hong Kong, China and the United States for further study.

;

;In 2005, Shang Xiaodong came to Guangdong and entered the South China Sea Institute of Oceanography, Chinese Academy of Sciences. Previously, Guangdong had just issued the “Decision on Accelerating the Construction of a Strong Science and Technology Province.” "There is a good scientific research atmosphere here, and there is a passion for pioneering and bold attempts. This is why our family chose to take root in Guangdong."

;

;Just returned to China At that time, ocean observation instruments had long been monopolized by foreign countries, so Shang Xiaodong decided to lead his team to independently develop ocean observation instruments. In the end, the team developed the "fast temperature sensor for ocean detection" with the fastest response in the world, with a response time of 7 milliseconds.

;

;Under the policy of "strengthening the province through science and technology", Guangdong also hopes to solve the problem of "two skins" between technology and economy. Empowering new manufacturing industries with new technologies focuses on the integration of technological innovation and industry.

;

;Yang Denghui said that after enrolling in a technician college in 2014, he "competed with things thinner than a hair every day."

;

;Yang Denghui, who was born as a technician, saw the new demand for talents behind the "manufacturing industry". “The key to success in the manufacturing industry lies in people.” He believes that in addition to scientific research talents like Shang Xiaodong, it also needs a large number of highly skilled talents to support it. This is an important reason why he chose to stay in Guangdong Mechanical Technician College to teach.

;

;After entering the school, Yang Denghui was selected into the training team preparing for the 43rd World Skills Competition. The training project was CNC milling, which is an automatic processing technology that uses computers. Drawing and programming realize part machining. At that time, China had not won a gold medal in this event.

;

;If you want to achieve success in CNC milling projects, you must practice "knife skills": choose appropriate tools according to different materials and production requirements of the parts, and strictly control them The accuracy of parts and components is controlled within 0.02 mm.

;

;In 2017, Yang Denghui, who started his career again, won the CNC milling championship at the 44th World Skills Competition. He was only 20 years old that year. After graduation, he joined the technical education team, and the students he guided won the world championship gold medal in this project again in 2019 and 2022.

;

;Data from the Guangdong Provincial Department of Human Resources and Social Security show that currently, the total number of skilled talents in Guangdong is 18.5 million, including 6.31 million highly skilled talents. Talents account for 34.1%. In 2023, Yang Denghui will also become a representative of the National People's Congress, and naturally he will focus on the cultivation of skilled talents in performing his duties.

;

;"(Hope) to help skilled employees break through the 'ceiling' for promotion, so that more talents can make a difference in Guangdong." Yang Denghui expressed at the event His vision.

;;At 13:29 on April 2, 2023, Jikun, Jiangyuan District, Baishan City, Jilin Province Mining Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as Jikun Coal Mine;) +290m east of Shimen South Wing, a large gas explosion accident occurred on the second floor of the fourth uphill coal mining face, causing 4 deaths and 4 injuries (another 4 people Physical discomfort, recovered after receiving oxygen), direct economic loss of 10.16 million yuan.

;

;After the accident, Jikun Coal Mine failed to report the accident as required, illegally transshipping and cremating the remains of the victims, and sealing off the accident site to conceal the accident. After receiving reports from the masses, when the Baishan City Emergency Management Bureau and the Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau went to the coal mine to verify the reported cases from April 3 to 12, 2023, the mine still did not report truthfully. On April 13th and 14th, four people including the mine investor and mine manager surrendered under pressure. The accident was verified to be true by the Baishan Municipal People's Government.

;

;Recently, the Jilin Bureau of the National Mine Safety Supervision Bureau released the accident investigation report.

;

;;;How the accident occurred;;

;

;During the day shift on April 2, 2023, mine manager Li Yonghai organized a pre-shift work meeting. Li Yanping, deputy director of production, Lu Wanping, chief engineer, and Li Shichen, technical consultant, assigned production tasks to each team. After the meeting, Yang Licheng, captain of the third mining team, assigned production tasks for the shift to Wang Hongchang, the squad leader of the accident squad.

;

;Wang Hongchang’s team has 13 people on duty and 1 tile inspector. Wang Hongchang arranged for Leng Jun, Ji Yaomin, Zhang Chengxue and Zhang Qinglong to set off cannons and produce coal at Sanshang Mountain. He, Wang Junfu and Sun Cheng set off cannons and produce coal at Sishang Mountain, Li Junsheng and Guo Wensheng built wood stacks for reinforcement at Wushang Mountain, and Yang Lianpeng and Gao Cai installed equipment in the main alley. Cars, Huang Fujun and Zhang Yongsheng are responsible for pulling coal. Lu Xiang is responsible for checking the gas.

;

;The workers entered the well from the abandoned heating tunnel at about 8:00, and picked up their own miner's lamps from the "Miner's Lamp Supermarket" there. They did not carry personnel identification cards and self-rescuers, and arrived at their respective operations at about 8:15. Place. At around 10 o'clock, in order to solve the ventilation problem at the Wushangshan working face, the ventilation team leader Guan Yanlin led three workers to move the local ventilator between Sishangshan and Wushangshan at +290m East Shimen back 20 meters and move it away from the wind The bifurcation of the cylinder connects the air duct to Wushangshan. This local ventilator supplies air to the three working surfaces of Sanshangshan, Sishangshan and Wushangshan at the same time.

;

;At around 13:30, Ji Yaomin and others who were working on Sanshang Mountain suddenly saw a puff of black smoke and the wind stopped. They felt difficulty breathing and could not see anything. Zhang Qinglong and Zhang Chengxue took the lead to escape. Ji Yaomin and Leng Jun took the tools and then ran outside. When they ran to Sanshang Pass, they found that there was wind in the alleyway. At this time, Zhang Qinglong and Zhang Chengxue were lying on the ground and lost consciousness. They immediately performed cardiopulmonary resuscitation and rescued them. About 5 minutes later, The two woke up.

;

;At this time, Liu Tiezhu, the project manager who was walking to the entrance of the central water pump room at +290m, felt a large fluctuation in the wind flow, and saw a lot of dust in the wind flow in the direction of Dongyi Shimen, so he went After checking, they saw the injured Lu Xiang, Gao Cai and Guo Wensheng respectively (Gao Cai and Guo Wensheng were seriously burned), and heard Leng Jun's voice at Mikami Pass, and then returned and took Lu Xiang to the +290m water pump room, and Call the dispatch office to report the incident.

;

;;;Accident rescue process;;

;

;After receiving the accident report, dispatcher Meng Fanjun reported the accident to mine director Li Yonghai. Yonghai immediately reported the situation to mine investor Wang Haoming and legal representative Cong Peifu, and arranged for Li Tao and Huo Jianguo to organize personnel to go down the mine to carry out rescue. Rescuers met survivors such as Lu Xiang, Zhang Chengxue, Ji Yaomin, Guo Wensheng, Huang Fujun and Zhang Yong, and sent people to escort them to the well. At the same time, a person (Yang Lianpeng) was found buried in coal at the fan switch, with only one leg exposed. He was confirmed dead at the scene.

;

;The rescuers found a fall at the Sishang Pass. They checked that the carbon monoxide concentration on the inside of the Sishang Pass was 999ppm (portable multi-function detector range 0~999ppm), the gas concentration was 0.1%, and the oxygen concentration was 5%. All people on the mountain were believed to have died, and the search for rescuers continued. When we reached the Sanshang Pass, coal fell and blocked the roadway. We found 4 people calling for help in Sanshang Mountain. We immediately cleared the coal and entered Sanshang Mountain to rescue the seriously injured Gao Cai and Li Junsheng. Then we lifted out Zhang Qinglong, who could not stand on his right leg, and finally Rescue Leng Jun and escort him to the surface. At 18:10, all survivors had reached the ground and were sent to hospitals for treatment.

;

;At 18:40, rescue workers began to clear the pile of coal where Yang Lianpeng died, and pulled out the body and transported it to the ground. Then the carbon monoxide was discharged section by section up the mountain. When the discharge reached 13 meters from the mountain pass, the deceased Wang Hongchang was found. The gas continued to be discharged, and the victims Wang Junfu and Sun Cheng were found about 1 meter below the shelter. So far, all the bodies of the victims have been found and transported to the ground.

;

;;;Direct reasons;;

;

;+290m East Shimensi Mountain is connected to the +355m goaf area, and gas surges in the goaf area out; a local ventilator was used to supply air to three working locations at the same time. The air volume was insufficient, causing gas accumulation, and the workers fired cannons in violation of regulations, leading to accidents.

;

;;;The accident concealment process;;

;

;After the accident, Wang Haoming, the investor and actual controller of Jikun Coal Mine, arranged for the mine manager Li Yonghai organized the rescue on his own without reporting to the emergency department; arranged for Wang Zhenshan and Wang Weidong to treat the injured and the aftermath of the deceased; arranged for Cong Peifu to assist the mine manager in handling the accident.

;

;Wang Weidong sent four seriously injured people to the Hunjiang District Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital, and then transferred them to the First Affiliated Hospital of Jilin University in Changchun City. Four workers who felt unwell were sent to Tonghua City Hospital for inhalation. Oxygen therapy. Wang Zhenshan sent the four victims to the Jiangyuan District Cemetery Funeral Home, Jiangyuan District Ni Tai Hospital, Sanchazi Forestry Bureau Hospital Morgue, and Textile Factory Funeral Home, and reached a compensation agreement with the families of the victims. Subsequently, he purchased two "Resident Death Medical Certificates (Inference)" (hereinafter referred to as "Death Certificates") from Wang Yonghai, director of the textile factory funeral home, for 50,000 yuan each, resulting in the illegal disposal of the remains of the two deceased persons. At the same time, Wang Zhenshan arranged for personnel to delete video surveillance data related to the accident on the afternoon of April 5, deliberately concealing the accident.

;

;At around 2:00 on April 3, after the on-site rescue work was completed, Li Yonghai arranged for Guan Yanlin to lead the ventilation team members into the well, and at the original sealed position of +290m East Shimen and +355m return air alley. Construct a "quick seal" to seal the accident scene.

;

;Concealing the verification process

;

;Since 23:00 on April 2, Baishan City Emergency Management Bureau, Jilin Provincial Emergency Management Department, and Provincial Party Committee Inspection Team have successively received reports about the Jikun Coal Mine accident. report. On April 3, the Baishan City Emergency Management Bureau took the lead in setting up a joint verification team with the Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau to verify the reported cases, inspected the safety monitoring system, personnel location monitoring system and video surveillance system, and conducted a review of the April 2 incident. During the day shift, 52 people working in the well were questioned and collected evidence. As of April 13, the inspection team found no signs of a gas accident in Jikun Coal Mine, and evidence collection from those who entered the mine on duty showed that no accident occurred in Jikun Coal Mine.

;

;On the morning of April 13, in accordance with the spirit of the Baishan Municipal Party Committee meeting on April 12, the relevant leaders of the Baishan City and Jiangyuan District governments took the lead and organized the Public Security Bureau, Emergency Management Bureau and other departments to establish a joint verification team. , conduct in-depth verification of reported matters. At 18:00 on April 13, Jikun Coal Mine Director Li Yonghai, legal representative Cong Peifu, and Deputy Mine Safety Manager Li Tao surrendered to the Jiangyuan District Public Security Bureau with the consent of investor Wang Haoming under pressure from the investigation, admitting that gas occurred underground in Jikun Coal Mine. The accident resulted in 4 deaths and 4 injuries. On April 14, investor Wang Haoming surrendered to the Jiangyuan District Public Security Bureau.

;

;After investigation and verification, the Baishan Municipal People's Government Office's "Explanation on the "4·2" Gas Accident of Jikun Mining Co., Ltd., Jiangyuan District, Baishan City" confirmed: at about 14:00 on April 2, 2023 , a gas accident occurred in Jikun Coal Mine, resulting in 4 deaths and 4 injuries. After on-site inspection by the mine rescue team of Tonghua Mining Group Company, the hidden area was sealed and comprehensively searched, and no other casualties were found.

;

;;;36 people were held accountable: ;;

;

;The accident investigation report put forward accountability and handling suggestions for 36 relevant responsible personnel. . Among them, 12 people were recommended to be transferred to judicial authorities for processing:

;

;10 people including the manager of Jikun Coal Mine, legal representative, investor (actual controller), chief engineer, and the outpatient department of Jiangyuan District Traditional Chinese Medicine Hospital A total of 12 suspected criminals, including the director and the director of the Jiangyuan District Textile Factory Funeral Home, were transferred to the judicial authorities for investigation and investigation.

;

;;;Eight people were recommended to be given administrative penalties: ;;

;

;Jikun Coal Mine Project Department Manager, Deputy Manager, and Deputy Safety General Manager Eight people including the engineer, deputy chief engineer of mechanical and electrical engineering and director of the dispatching office were respectively imposed administrative penalties and had their professional qualifications revoked.

;

;;;15 people were recommended to be held accountable for party and government discipline: ;;

;

;The employment contracts of three mine safety supervisors were terminated and Ordered not to engage in coal mine safety production work within the administrative area of ​​Jilin Province.

;

;The director of the Wangou Town Safety Supervision Branch of the Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau was given a one-year party probation and was removed from office.

;

;The person in charge of the second office of the Coal Supervision Section of the Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau was given a serious demerit penalty and removed from office.

;

;Criticize and educate the executive deputy director of Jiangyuan District People’s Government.

;

;To the deputy director in charge and captain of the law enforcement detachment of Baishan City Emergency Management Bureau, the former party secretary and director and deputy director in charge of Jiangyuan District Emergency Management Bureau, the party committee secretary, town mayor and deputy town mayor of Wangou Town and Nine public officials, including the president and vice president of Jiangyuan District Hospital of Traditional Chinese Medicine, were given party disciplinary and government sanctions.

;

;;;Jikun Coal Mine was fined and closed;;

;

;A total of 5 million was fined for concealing the occurrence of a major accident in Jikun Coal Mine and concealing the report. A fine of RMB 10,000 was included in the joint punishment targets;

;

;Jikun Coal Mine did not obtain a safety production license and illegally produced coal outside the scope of technical transformation design. It was an illegal coal mine and its illegal gains and mined coal and mining were confiscated. equipment, and be fined and requested to the Baishan Municipal People's Government to close it down in accordance with the law.

; Sat, 04 Nov 2023 10:55:07 +0800 在上海，他们进行了一场现实主义“万梗节”狂欢http://www.infzm.com/contents/259893
;;2023-11-04 10:00:00;
;

;;

;

;On October 31, 2023, on Julu Road in Shanghai, a young man cosplayed White Snake and Fa Hai. (Visual China/Photo)

;

;Halloween has passed, but the "Ten Thousand Stem Festival" has not. This large-scale carnival still has lingering warmth in the metropolis of Shanghai.

;

;November 1st every year is the traditional Western festival of Halloween. The most lively moment is on Halloween, when children dress up as various cute ghosts, knock on doors and do trick-or-treating.

;

;Halloween in Shanghai in 2023 comes earlier. Starting from October 28, the city switches to the magical side. Major theme parks and some Internet celebrity bars will hold Halloween activities, as well as spontaneous street parties. Monsters and monsters of different shapes appeared on the street. What is unexpected is that Internet memes with a strong Chinese style have suddenly emerged and become popular all over the Internet. They are dubbed as a new trend of "Renaissance".

;

;When the lanterns come on, an ordinary old street can turn into a movable feast. It will be a fairy tale world where you can cosplay various characters and experience another identity; it can be a channel to release stress and express yourself; it can also be a traffic pool full of temptations. The cosplayers in the pool are eye-catching enough, and there are precedents for Xiti’s hot search lists on major platforms, which means that traffic and money will have the opportunity to be included in the bag.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters interviewed more than a dozen "crazy citizens". According to them, Shanghai has not been this lively for a long time.

;

;;

;

;On October 30, the Julu Road area was crowded with people. (Visual China/Photo)

;

;"Pure happiness" on Julu Road

;

;After leaving the subway station, the flow of people under the bright yellow lights was surging in one direction. Even without navigation, you can determine the general direction of Julu Road. The closer you get there, the denser the crowds will be.

;

;The location with the strongest Halloween atmosphere is Julu Road in Huangpu District, Shanghai. This is a commercial street named after the giant cruise ship "Julu" of the French Post Line. There are many exotic and Western-style shops. Historical buildings spread across this prosperous area. The most iconic one is the Sunken Plaza at No. 158 Julu Road, which has always been the most popular place to visit on Halloween.

;

;On the evening of October 31st, the night in Shanghai was getting darker and the carnival began. There is Tathagata Buddha riding a shared bicycle inadvertently passing by, exuding golden light; there is a zombie bride and the fire ghost king who are all dressed in red; there is also Lu Xun in a long robe, lamenting that studying medicine cannot save the Chinese people ; Pretending to be a potted plant, acting out a famous painting, or even raising a middle finger in a headband can create a bizarre landscape... The journey from Julu Road to Fuxing Park, less than 1 kilometer away, is packed with people.

;

;The level of crowding made police nervous. The entrance to Julu Road has been blocked by police with iron railings, and blue and red police lights are flashing everywhere. While maintaining order, the traffic police repeatedly emphasized: "I am not a cosplayer."

;

;Even the fence could not stop the enthusiastic flow of people. They took a shortcut from the nearby green slope about ten meters and sneaked into Julu road. Southern Weekend reporters followed the flow of people up the slope. Looking from above, Julu Road looked like a colorful light strip. The crowds of people almost filled the entire space on the road and flowed slowly.

;

;The adjacent Chengdu South Road disperses some of the flow of people overflowing from Julu Road. Relatively speaking, this place is a lot ordinary. There are two or three-story private houses on both sides of the road, full of clothing stores, leather bag stalls, taverns and fly restaurants. A restaurant owner sitting on the street is surrounded by a crowd of people. "Normally there are not many people." Here, from last Saturday until now, there are many people in the store."

;

;If you take a few steps, you will see large and small black and white impermanences. They hold long red tongues. On their black and white high hats are written "Peace in the world" and "Wealth at first sight". , including many children wearing thick black eye shadow and looking cute. At the corner, I met the White Snake and Fahai living in harmony. The masked men from the popular Korean drama "Squid Game" stood in a row against the wall and obediently cooperated with tourists to take photos. It had nothing to do with horror.

;

;The most eye-catching people at the scene were the boys cosplaying Batman. They were tall and tall, with black masks covering their eyes, clear mandibles and indifferent expressions. From time to time, girls around him would scream, "So handsome."

;

;The Batmans have been touring twice, always causing commotion at the scene. Their trump card is to take off their tight tops and expose their porcelain chest muscles if they disagree. Circle after circle of people gathered around to cheer. The tourists on the outside couldn't see it. They just stood on tiptoe and pointed their raised mobile phones towards the center to take pictures.

;

;Within only three seconds, the Batmans were pushed out of the crowd by the police, and there was a burst of laughter from the crowd. This is a routine operation to maintain order on Halloween. People and "ghosts" causing congestion will be taken away by the police and moved to another place to ease the flow of people.

;

;;

;

;Batman hunk. Photo by Li Zixuan

;

;A God of Wealth holding a gold ingot was undoubtedly respected. There was a long queue of tourists taking photos. Some people clasped their hands and bowed their heads in worship to the God of Wealth, begging her to bless them with good fortune. For about half an hour, the God of Wealth was blocked and did not move a step. The gold ingot was touched here and there. Every time he wanted to leave, he was pulled back by the person who took the photo.

;

;The faces of the elderly also appeared in the crowd, and they were also very busy. Maybe it’s because “I can’t understand it, but I’m very shocked.” An elderly man sighed, “We also get to know the things of young people. It’s lively, fun, and fresh.”

; < p>; "Don't you think this is a release? A release of stress." Another Shanghai uncle talked to a Southern Weekend reporter. He had been standing on the roadside for two hours, observing and feeling the carnival atmosphere. My uncle is from Shanghai, but he has never seen such an atmosphere. "I am very happy to see such an atmosphere. I think everyone is also happy from the bottom of their hearts. This is not a festival. Everyone is just using the festival as an excuse to be happy." , pure joy.”

;

;“Go crazy together and release stress”

;

;A novel scene appeared at the subway entrance near Julu Road. Many people gathered together to exchange professional opinions. So much so that the subway entrance was blocked again. Some said they were studying law, some were studying civil engineering, and some were studying architecture. Everyone complained that it was difficult to get along in the corresponding industry.

;

;What resonated strongly was the boy surrounded by Xiao Xie. He looked haggard and had pale lips. The card hanging on his chest had four big words written on it: Studying Architecture. He was also carrying two wads of toilet paper. take-out box, looking impoverished. "It is true that this industry is not very prosperous, and my work is not going well, so I take this opportunity to go crazy together."

;

;"Everyone is going crazy, and I want to go crazy too. It feels so good, and I put all my inner thoughts into it." Release the pressure." Xiao Xie just did a bold thing and resigned naked in October 2023. It was a period of work where "I couldn't move even if I wanted to curl up, but I didn't dare to lie down". Everyone didn't dare to leave their seats after get off work, and they were chased by their leaders to make work demands.

;

;The migrant worker who is even more out of the circle is Li Qiubai, the actor of Party B who wanders the same street. His makeup was rough and exaggerated. The dark eyeshadow and highlighter applied on his face made it look like his cheekbones were protruding and his cheeks were sunken. He had an A4 paper with "Party B" written on it in the collar of his checkered shirt, clearly showing a person who had been squeezed by Party A for a long time. haggard beat worker.

;

;;

;

;Party B cosplayer. Photo provided by the interviewee

;

;“I cosplayed a character who had just finished his shift, and I didn’t expect the effect to be so good.” Li Qiubai had indeed just finished his shift, and it was already late at night when he arrived at Julu Road, so he decided to perform a Party B, who was tired, was constantly surrounded by people taking photos. The number of views on his social account has "exploded", and many netizens have left messages expressing sympathy. "Some people read the jokes, and some people look in the mirror. There are many comments like this."

;

;"Maybe it's because after the epidemic, there is no such activity that everyone can enjoy. Although the previous festivals were holidays, various tickets were not available." Li Qiubai said that now it has reached a In a festival where everyone can go crazy, I have an outlet to vent.

;

;Here, Li Qiubai also encountered many poor people who did not need to dress up, as well as the resentful Party A. Some people held up signs: "People who usually have a hard time pretending to be themselves don't need to dress up for Halloween." It's OK." Li Qiubai summed up this type of cosplay as: using realistic expression techniques to present the things that workers fear most.

;

;On the evening of October 31st, many cosplayers said they came over right after get off work. A King Zhou finished putting on a solemn dramatic face in his company, and walked around the streets to find two strangers, Daji, to form a CP; a 28-year-old young man drove here from Jiaxing City, Zhejiang Province, and she cosplayed Hayao Miyazaki's classic animated character, the Faceless Man, stood hunched silently on the roadside, with more than a hundred people gathered around to take a group photo. Because she had to go to work the next day, she returned to Jiaxing overnight.

;

;Wang Gongzi chose to release herself in another way. She played the role of SpongeBob SquarePants, who is also 37 years old. On weekdays, she is engaged in the company's business work, talking about cost-effectiveness and the company's maximum benefits. But before Halloween comes, the homemade yellow felt board square shell makes her purely the embodiment of happiness.

;

;When Mr. Wang cosplayed Spongebob Squarepants into Happy Valley, he immediately became the center of attention and was even mistaken by tourists for being a professional staff member of the park. A crowd of chirping children followed her, stuffing her with candies and throwing out a hundred thousand whys: Did Mr. Krabs give you a day off? Why don't you bring Xiaowei to play with you? What’s the secret ingredient to the Krusty Krab?

;

;That night, Mr. Wang said, the whole group went crazy. Di Dixi, a colleague cosplaying as a Haidilao waiter, was originally a typical i person (referring to an introvert). In this atmosphere, she was directly reshaped into an e person (referring to an extrovert). She would take the initiative to get in front of some tourists. There is no real thing to do in the crazy performance, just twisting the hands in the air, but it is self-intoxicating.

;

;That night, Di Dixi also interviewed "Li Jiaqi", a cosplayer who sells eyebrow pencils for 79 yuan. The other person responded in a long voice, "Why is it so expensive? It's always the same price. It's really annoying." Dixi burst into laughter on the spot. Later, this video unexpectedly went viral. Prince Wang and his friends were all shocked. Is the Sheniu girl in front of them the same Didixi who dared not speak in front of others and pretended to be immersed in looking at her mobile phone?

;

;"She became more aggressive after she woke up the next day. Looking back, she felt so embarrassed and a little bit ashamed." Didisi's friend recalled to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;Within a few days, Didixi led her two friends who were smarter than herself and headed towards Julu Road. She put on heavy makeup and went back.

;

;;

;

;There are people on the street who are cosplaying and learning computers. (Visual China/Picture)

;

;“Take advantage of the popularity to become a fan”

;

;Chen Yanzhi is on the hot search again. In 2022, he was dressed like An Lingrong and danced on roller skates, which made him a hot search. After all, "The Legend of Zhen Huan" is the "electronic mustard" for all.

;

;In this sea of ​​folk joy, Halloween has also become a traffic carnival, with many video teams wandering around.

;

;“She is so hot.” ​​A Ying, who cosplayed An Lingrong’s Maid, was a little proud. She told Southern Weekend reporters that after deciding to perform the scene of “An Lingrong singing on the bow”, several commercials A team of people made careful planning and posted a "thaw" trailer on the short video platform, implying An Lingrong's return. They also made a video invitation with a route plan.

;

;“What we are looking for is Lalamove to drag the prop boat over. As soon as it got off the cargo puller, many people called An Lingrong.” On the evening of October 28, An Lingrong was sitting on the boat. As soon as he came out, he was surrounded by a crowd of people, which directly diverted the traffic of other nearby cosplayers. They put on cheap wigs and the same costumes as in the play. An Lingrong on the bow of the boat was holding a lotus. The music "Lotus Can Be Picked in Jiangnan" was played on the Bluetooth speaker, and everyone sang along.

;

;The number of likes for the short video shot by the team at that time soared to tens of thousands. When it came to Fuxing Park for the second time, thousands of people watched the live broadcast. "It's quite fun. Everyone came up with a lot of creative ideas. I finally saw how relaxed the people in Shanghai are." A Ying said.

;

;An Lingrong’s previous appearance in the industry also inspired the Hangzhou boy Xingxing. In this Halloween, he became popular with his cosplay of Xiang Tai. In one of his most widely circulated videos, Xingxing is wearing a pink coat that the team temporarily bought for 400 yuan, looking rich and wealthy. Someone asked him what he thought of Xiangtai's daughter-in-law Guo Biting. He smiled slightly and imitated: "It's easy to control."

;

;In response, Xiangtai himself responded from a distance: "The clothes are too low, he should imitate Make it more beautiful." This shocked the Xingxing team. Originally, everyone joked that the Halloween cosplay star lineup would be enough to receive letters from lawyers from all the celebrities on the Internet, but it was so popular that people were still caught off guard. "We were actually a little scared, afraid that if the Xiangzuo team came to us and asked us if we had any problems, but in the end they only said to interact, then we went to interact." Ami, a staff member of the Xingxing team, told a Southern Weekend reporter.

;

;Ami introduced that Xingxing is a self-media beauty blogger. After causing trouble with Taizhuang, many cooperative merchants approached us, "Many people sent us private messages to discuss cooperation. We should wake up We woke up and pretended to interact with each other, but we refused because we were afraid of being scolded."

;

;Some people were worried and some were happy. After seeing Xiang Tai and An Lingrong become popular on the Internet, Na Ying, the actor who plays Na Ying, was also moved. "Then I have to go." On November 1, she imitated Na Ying's tone on the other end of the phone when being interviewed by a Southern Weekend reporter.此前，她买来《妻子的秘密》剧中黎明朗的衣服，最低配版的墨镜、发夹和话筒，连去巨鹿路三晚，模仿那英不断输出“那言那语”，“我一张嘴，他们就嗷嗷叫唤”。

;

;效果立竿见影。这英版的那英，走到哪里都自带流量，即使是戴上口罩，摘掉眼镜，换上朋友的衣服，还是会被人认出来，狠狠体验了一把明星被追的待遇。 “他们以为我是真的那英，所有人尖叫，说太像了，喊'那姐，别跑'，'那姐，给我拍照'。”

;

;“我去之前我就知道会出圈，只是不确定会出圈到什么程度。”三天下来，这英的抖音粉丝涨了近十万，她紧紧抓住流量密码，“万圣节当晚回到家后，我还开了一场直播，希望可以趁着热度涨点粉”。

;

;在10月31日现场狂欢中，一声嘶吼突然让噪杂的人群顿了一下。 “还让不让人过了？”一个陷在人流里的外卖小哥发了火，他的车轮此刻寸步难行。

;

;但很快气氛就恢复了，这样的场景并不陌生，时不时就有外卖员在沸腾的人群里嚷嚷：“让一让，超时了，超时了。”在这场分不清楚真真假假的狂欢活动中，很难不让人怀疑，他们是在cos外卖小哥。在采访期间，也有人向南方周末记者投来疑惑的眼神，问“你是在cos记者吗？”

;

;直到临近午夜时分，巨鹿路的人流逐渐淡了下来。跨过这个夜晚，上海又将回归大都市节奏紧张的一面。
